DataElement.preferredName: Copy Number Analysis Programming Parameter Hidden Markov Model Copy Number State Value double Collection
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.:Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it.:A value that is passed to a routine._A statistical model in which the system being modeled has unknown parameters, but the hidden parameters can be determined from the observable parameters. While the state is not directly visible, the variables influenced by the state are visible. Each state has a probability distribution over the possible output tokens. Therefore the sequence of tokens generated by a Hidden Markov Model (HMM) gives some information about the sequence of states.:The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.:The way something is with respect to its main attributes.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed._Generic value domain for a collection of double-precision floating point numbers (64-bit IEEE 7540).

Property.preferredName: Hidden Markov Model Copy Number State Value
Property.preferredDefinition: A statistical model in which the system being modeled has unknown parameters, but the hidden parameters can be determined from the observable parameters. While the state is not directly visible, the variables influenced by the state are visible. Each state has a probability distribution over the possible output tokens. Therefore the sequence of tokens generated by a Hidden Markov Model (HMM) gives some information about the sequence of states.:The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.:The way something is with respect to its main attributes.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A statistical model in which the system being modeled has unknown parameters, but the hidden parameters can be determined from the observable parameters. While the state is not directly visible, the variables influenced by the state are visible. Each state has a probability distribution over the possible output tokens. Therefore the sequence of tokens generated by a Hidden Markov Model (HMM) gives some information about the sequence of states.
The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.
The way something is with respect to its main attributes.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
